intro: Erigeron leioreades, commonly known as blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a basal rosette of silver-blue leaves and produces showy, fluffy blue-gray flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is drought-tolerant once established. Erigeron leioreades is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
